intro: Memecylon toamasinense, commonly known as the Toamasina memecylon, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Memecylon toamasinense is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, where it thrives in the understory vegetation.
